changes.text: The threshold for central government procurement contracts shall be €200,000, replacing the previous €150,000, effective 1 January 2025.
Member States shall publish annual reports on contracts exceeding the threshold.

messages.content:
• **Threshold increase**: Procurement contracts that were previously approved up to €150,000 must now be limited to €200,000 starting 1 Jan 2025. Existing contracts above €150,000 need review.
• **Reporting requirement**: Annual reports must now capture all contracts above the new €200,000 threshold and be aligned with EU‑mandated publication standards.
Storing the regulation update for audit purposes.

arguments.content: Directive 2024/45/EU – amendment of public procurement thresholds to €200,000 and new annual reporting obligations.

messages.content: Generating a Slack alert for the procurement team.

arguments.title: EU Procurement Threshold Updated to €200,000 (Effective 01‑Jan‑2025)
arguments.body:
## New EU Public‑Procurement Threshold
- **Effective Date:** 1 January 2025
- **Change:** Threshold rises from €150,000 to **€200,000**.
- **Impact:** All pending and future contracts must be reviewed to ensure compliance.
- **Action Required:**
  1. Update the internal procurement policy (Control PRC‑THR‑001).
  2. Adjust the annual reporting template (Control PRC‑REPORT‑002).
  3. Notify relevant stakeholders.

_Reference: Directive 2024/45/EU (Record ID: RecordID_20241013_001)_
